newsitem.title: CHINA: Chinese province achieves record rice yields.
newsitem.headline: Chinese province achieves record rice yields.

text.p: Output of early rice in China's southern province of Guangdong reached a record 6,210 kg per hectare, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
It was the first time that yields in the province had surpassed 6,000 kg per hectare, the agency said.
Total output from the 1.3 million hectares planted with early rice reached 8.1 million tonnes, 380,000 tonnes more than last year, it said, quoting statistics from the local agriculture department.
Guangdong is one of China's leading rice producing areas.
